title: Consider a single hierarchy of Google Cloud resources. Which of these situations is possible? (Choose 3 responses.)
supportiveInfo: The reason for this question is because such and such

options.title: There is no organization node, but there is at least one folder.
There is no organization node, and there are no folders.
There are two or more organization nodes.
There is an organization node, and there is at least one folder.
There is an organization node, and there are no folders.

title: What is the difference between Identity and Access Management (IAM) basic roles and IAM predefined roles?
supportiveInfo: The reason for this question is because such and such

options.title: Basic roles only apply to the owner of the Google Cloud project. Predefined roles can be associated with any user.
Basic roles can only be granted to single users. Predefined roles can be associated with a group.
Basic roles only allow viewing, creating, and deleting resources. Predefined roles allow any modification.
Basic roles affect all resources in a Google Cloud project. Predefined roles apply to a specific service in a project.

title: Select the option that displays IAM roles from general to specific.
supportiveInfo: The reason for this question is because such and such

options.title: Custom roles, predefined roles, basic roles
Basic roles, predefined roles, custom roles
Predefined roles, custom roles, basic roles

title: Which statement best describes how Google Cloud resources are associated within the resource hierarchy?
supportiveInfo: All Google Cloud resources are associated with a project.

options.title: All Google Cloud resources are associated with a project.
Google Cloud resources are not associated with the resource hierarchy.
All Google Cloud resources are associated with a folder.
All Google Cloud resources are associated with an organization.

title: How does the resource hierarchy control how IAM policies are inherited?

options.title: IAM policies that are implemented by lower-level policies can override the policies defined at a higher level.
GIAM policies that are implemented higher in the resource hierarchy deny access that is granted by lower-level policies.
IAM policies are only implemented at the project level; they cannot be amended by lower levels of the resource hierarchy.

title: Which way of accessing Google Cloud lets you control services through the code you write?

options.title: APIs
The Cloud SDK and Cloud Shell
The Cloud Console mobile app
The Cloud Console

title: When would you choose to have an organization node? (Select two)

options.title: When you want to organize resources into projects
When you want to create folders
When you want to centrally apply organization-wide policies
There’s no choice; organization nodes are mandatory.

title: Your company has two Google Cloud projects and you want them to share policies. What is the least error-prone way to set this up?

options.title: Define the new shared policy in the organization node.
Place both projects into a folder, and define the policies on that folder.
Duplicate all the policies from one project onto the other.
Create shared resource policies on the common resources that are used in both projects.

title: Which statement describes the correct Cloud Storage use case?

options.title: Cloud Storage provides durable and highly available object storage.
Cloud Storage provides the root file system of a Linux virtual machine.
Cloud Storage provides data warehousing services.
Cloud Storage provides RDBMS (Relational Database Management System) services.

title: How are Firestore and Bigtable alike? (Select two answers.)

options.title: They both offer SQL-like queries.
They are both highly scalable.
They both have a free daily quota.
They are both NoSQL databases.

title: Which SQL database service can scale to petabyte database sizes?

options.title: Firestore
Cloud Spanner
Cloud SQL
Bigtable

title: Your application needs to store data with strong transactional consistency, and you want seamless scaling up. Which storage option is the best choice for your application?

options.title: Cloud SQL
Cloud Spanner
Firestore
Bigtable

title: You manufacture devices with sensors and need to stream huge amounts of data from these devices to a storage option in the cloud. Which storage option is the best choice for your application?

options.title: Cloud SQL
Cloud Spanner
Firestore
Bigtable

title: Why would a customer consider the Coldline Storage class?

options.title: To save money on storing frequently accessed data
To save money on storing infrequently accessed data
To improve security
To use the Coldline Storage API

title: Which statement best describes how VPC routers and firewalls work?

options.title: They are managed by Google in virtual machines and customers cannot modify them.
They are managed by Google as a built-in feature.
They are managed by Google in virtual machines and customers can tune or deactivate them.
Customers provision virtual machines and run their routers and firewalls in them.

title: A Google Cloud customer wants to load-balance traffic among the backend VMs that form part of a multi-tier application. Which load-balancing option should this customer choose?

options.title: The regional internal load balancer
The global TCP proxy
The global HTTP(S) load balancer
The regional load balancer
The global SSL proxy

title: Preemptible VMs can offer advantages over a standard Compute Engine VM. What is a reason customers choose preemptible VMs?
supportiveInfo: The per-hour price of preemptible VMs incorporates a substantial discount.

options.title: To reduce cost
To reduce cost on premium operating systems
To use custom machine types
To improve performance

title: Which interconnect option is a service level agreement (SLA) available for?

options.title: Direct Peering
Dedicated Interconnect
Carrier Peering
Standard Network Tier

title: Which term describes a secure, individual, private cloud-computing model hosted within a public cloud?

options.title: Virtual private cloud (VPC)
Content delivery network (CDN)
Virtual private network (VPN)
Domain name system (DNS)

title: Select the true statement about Google’s VPC networks and subnets.

options.title: Networks are regional, and subnets are zonal.
Networks are global, and subnets are regional.
Networks are global, and subnets are zonal.
Both networks and subnets are global.

title: Select two reasons for using containers to deploy applications. (Choose 2 responses.)

options.title: Allocating resources in which to run containers is not necessary.
It creates consistency across development, testing, and production environments.
Migrating workloads is simpler.
It provides tight coupling between applications and operating systems.

title: What is a Kubernetes pod?

options.title: A group of nodes
A group of clusters
A group of VMs
A group of containers

title: How do containers access an operating system?

options.title: Containers use a shared base operating system stored in a shared kernel layer.
Each container has its own instance of an operating system.
Containers use a shared base operating system stored in a shared runtime layer.
Containers use a shared base operating system stored in a Cloud Storage bucket.

title: Where do the resources used to build Google Kubernetes Engine clusters come from?

options.title: Compute Engine
Bare metal servers
App Engine
Cloud Storage

title: What is a Kubernetes cluster?

options.title: A group of containers that provide high availability for applications.
A group of pods that manage the administration of a Kubernetes application.
A group of machines where Kubernetes can schedule workloads.

title: How do you keep your Kubernetes version updated in Google Kubernetes Engine?

options.title: You are required to set up a cron job to periodically check the Kubernetes version in your cluster.
The Google Kubernetes Engine team periodically performs automatic upgrades of your cluster to newer stable versions.
You cannot update a running cluster. You need to create a copy of the cluster with the updated Kubernetes version.
You need to stop your cluster and manually update the Kubernetes version in your cluster.

title: Anthos provides a rich set of tools for monitoring and maintaining the consistency of your applications across which of the following locations?

options.title: Applications hosted with multiple cloud providers only.
Applications hosted with one cloud provider only.
Applications hosted on-premises, in the cloud, or in multiple clouds.
Applications hosted on-premises only.

title: What are the advantages of using App Engine’s flexible environment instead of its standard environment? (Select 3).

options.title: Google provides automatic in-place security patches.
Your application can write to the local disk.
You can install third-party binaries across all languages.
Your application can execute code in background threads.
You can use SSH to connect to the virtual machines on which your application runs.

title: Select the managed compute platform that lets you run stateless containers through web requests or Pub/Sub events.

options.title: Cloud Run
Cloud Endpoints
Apigee API Management
Cloud Source Repositories

title: Cloud Run can only pull images from:

options.title: Docker Hub
GitHub
Self-hosted registries
Artifact Registry

title: App Engine is best suited to the development and hosting of which type of application?

options.title: A web application
A long-running batch processing application
Applications that require at least one instance running at all times.
Applications that require full control of the hardware they are running on

title: Which Google Cloud service should you choose to perform business analytics and billing on a customer-facing API?

options.title: Cloud Run API
Apigee API Management
Cloud Endpoints
Compute Engine API

title: Which statements are true about App Engine? (Select 2).

options.title: App Engine manages the hardware and networking infrastructure required to run your code.
The daily billing for an App Engine application can drop to zero.
App Engine charges you based on the resources you preallocate instead of the resources you use.
Developers who write for App Engine do not need to code their applications in any particular way to use the service.
App Engine requires you to supply or code your own application load balancing and logging services.

title: Select the advantage of putting the event-driven components of your application into Cloud Functions.

options.title: In Cloud Functions, code can be written in C# or C++.
Cloud Functions handles scaling these components seamlessly.
Cloud Functions eliminates the need to use a separate service to trigger application events.
In Cloud Functions, processing is always free of charge.

title: Why would a developer choose to store source code in Cloud Source Repositories? (Select 2)

options.title: To keep code private to a Google Cloud project
It is the only way to access your source code in a repository.
To reduce work
To have total control over the hosting infrastructure

title: Why might a Google Cloud customer choose to use Terraform?

options.title: Terraform can be used as an infrastructure management system for Kubernetes pods.
Terraform can be used to enforce maximum resource utilization and spending limits on your Google Cloud resources.
Terraform can be used as an infrastructure management system for Google Cloud resources.
Terraform can be used as a version-control system for your Google Cloud infrastructure layout.

title: Why might a Google Cloud customer choose to use Cloud Functions?

options.title: Cloud Functions is a free service for hosting compute operations.
Their application has a legacy monolithic structure that they want to separate into microservices.
Their application contains event-driven code that they don't want to provision compute resources for.
Cloud Functions is the primary way to run Node.js applications in Google Cloud.

title: You want to create alerts on your Google Cloud resources, such as when health checks fail. Which is the best Google Cloud product to use?

options.title: Cloud Monitoring
Cloud Functions
Cloud Trace
Error Reporting

title: Which definition best describes a service level indicator (SLI)?

options.title: A percentage goal of a measure you intend your service to achieve
A carefully selected monitoring metric that measures one aspect of a service's reliability.
A contract with your customers regarding service performance
A key performance indicator; for example, clicks per session or customer signups

title: Select the two correct statements about Cloud Logging.

options.title: Cloud Logging requires the use of a third-party monitoring agent.
Cloud Logging lets you define metrics based on your logs.
Cloud Logging lets you define uptime checks.
Cloud Logging requires you to store your logs in BigQuery or Cloud Storage.
Cloud Logging lets you view logs from your applications and filter and search on them.

title: Which option describes a commitment made to your customers that your systems and applications will have only a certain amount of “downtime”?

options.title: Key performance indicator
Service level indicator
Service level objective
Service level agreement

title: There are “Four Golden Signals” that measure a system’s performance and reliability. What are they?

options.title: Latency, traffic, saturation, errors
Availability, durability, scalability, resiliency
Get, post, put, delete
KPIs, SLIs, SLOs, SLAs
